title:
Angular Momentum Flux in Scalar-Tensor Theories up to 1.5 post-Newtonian
  Order
abstract:
We compute the angular momentum flux from a non-circular nonspinning binary
system of compact objects in massless scalar-tensor theories up to one and a
half post-Newtonian (1.5PN) order using multipole moments. The angular momentum
flux in scalar-tensor theories involves both a tensorial and a scalar
contribution which can be further decomposed as instantaneous, tail and
non-linear memory effects up to 1.5PN order. We compute the explicit
expressions of tail effects using the Fourier decomposition of tensorial and
scalar multipole moments, and non-linear memory effects using the Newtonian
order quasi-Keplerian representation of elliptic orbits in scalar-tensor
theories. This work is important to construct the radiation-reaction force and
hence the waveform templates for eccentric binaries in scalar-tensor theories
of gravity.
